DataElement.preferredName: Patient Discontinue Strong Cytochrome P450 Inhibition Induction Agent Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response for questions related to the patient's discontinuation of of strong cytochrome P450 system inhibitors and/or inducers.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Discontinue Strong Cytochrome P450 Inhibition Induction Agent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._To stop or end, permanently or temporarily._Having strength, power, or intensity greater than average or expected._A family of cytochromes that are involved in electron transport and oxidative metabolism of drugs and other bioactive molecules. When the catalytic heme is reduced the absorbance peak for this protein occurs at 450 nm._The interference with or prevention of an action or response even though the stimulus for that action or response is present._The act of bringing about something._An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Discontinue Strong Cytochrome P450 Inhibition Induction Agent
Property.preferredDefinition: To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.:Having strength, power, or intensity greater than average or expected.:A family of cytochromes that are involved in electron transport and oxidative metabolism of drugs and other bioactive molecules. When the catalytic heme is reduced the absorbance peak for this protein occurs at 450 nm.:The interference with or prevention of an action or response even though the stimulus for that action or response is present.:The act of bringing about something.:An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.

Concepts.definition: To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.
Having strength, power, or intensity greater than average or expected.

A family of cytochromes that are involved in electron transport and oxidative metabolism of drugs and other bioactive molecules. When the catalytic heme is reduced the absorbance peak for this protein occurs at 450 nm.
The interference with or prevention of an action or response even though the stimulus for that action or response is present.
The act of bringing about something.
An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is patient unable to disconti
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue drugs that are strong cytochrome P450 3A4 (CYP3A4), P450 3A5 (CYP3A5), cytochrome P450 2C19 (CYP2C19), cytochrome P450 2C8 (CYP 2C8), and cytochrome P450 (CYP 2C9) inhibitors and/or inducers?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue drugs that are strong cytochrome P450 3A4 (CYP3A4), P450 3A5 (CYP3A5), cytochrome P450 2C19 (CYP2C19), cytochrome P450 2C8 (CYP 2C8), and cytochrome P450 (CYP 2C9) inhibitors and/or inducers at least one week prior to study registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue drugs that are strong cytochrome P450 3A4 (CYP3A4), P450 3A5 (CYP3A5), cytochrome P450 2C19 (CYP2C19), and cytochrome P450 2C9 (CYP 2C9) inhibitors and/or inducers and substrates of CYP 3A 4/5, CYP1A2, UGT1A1 or BCRP that are sensitive or have a narrow therapeutic window, at least one week prior to study registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue drugs that are strong cytochrome P450 3A4 (CYP3A4) or P450 3A5 (CYP3A5), cytochrome P450 2C19 (CYP2C19), and cytochrome P450 2C9 (CYP 2C9) inhibitors and/or inducers and substrates of CYP 3A 4/5 or CYP1A2, that are sensitive or have a narrow therapeutic window, at least one week prior to study registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue drugs that are strong cytochrome P450 3A4 (CYP3A4) or P450 3A5 (CYP3A5), cytochrome P450 2C19 (CYP2C19),  and cytochrome P450 2C9 (CYP 2C9) inhibitors and/or inducers and substrates of CYP 3A 4/5 or CYP1A2, that are sensitive or have a narrow therapeutic window, at least three weeks prior to study registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue concomitant medications or herbal supplements that are strong inhibitors or strong inducers of cytochrome P450 (CYP) isoenzymes CYP3A4/5, CYP2C9 and CYP2C19 within the protocol specified timelines?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving any medications or substances that are strong inhibitors or inducers of CYP3A4 or substrates of CYP1A2 with narrow therapeutic windows and is unable to discontinue strong inhibitors or inducers of CYP3A4 least 7 days prior to the first dose of ZEN00369?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving any medications or substances that are strong inhibitors or inducers of CYP3A4 or P-gp, strong inhibitors of BCRP, sensitive substrates of CYP1A2, proton-pump-inhibitors and they cannot be discontinued at least 7 days prior to the first dose of ZEN003694 (ZEN-3694)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to discontinue strong inhibitors of CYP3A4 at least 7 days, and inducers 14 days prior to the first dose of ZEN003694 and capecitabine?
